Introduction
  • Usage

Usage

Feb 8, 2016

To use this Jekyll server, you just need to fork the jekyll-api-theme project into your own repository, and start adding content in the _posts folder.

The way the documentation generates, you will need to create 2 posts for your content. The first content will render as text documentation in the center column. The second content will render as example code in the right-most column.

This is an example of a post rendering in the main column.

To define posts as sections in the sidebar to the left, you simply need to add a section parameter to the post header.
